pageContext.description:
A fragment of a copper alloy rapier or dagger blade of Bronze Age date. The fragment is rectangular in plan and eliptical to lozenge-shaped in cross-section, tapering out from a central rib. The edges are chipped and damaged but appear to have been straight. One end terminates in a diagonal break, the other in a straight break. There is green patina around the diagonal break, the rest of the object has a dark olive brown patina.



Similar objects on this database, for example WILT-9D21F1, SUR-750511, WILT-90C8FE are dated to the Middle Bronze Age, circa 1500 - 1200 BC.



The fragment is 42.4 mm long, 11.6 mm wide and 3.8 mm thick. Weight is 7.9 g.
